snippet: Google’s product launch on Tuesday was as much a jab at Apple Inc’s iPhone as a sales pitch for its new Pixel phones, with executives from the Mountain View internet search company taking shots at their competitor at every turn.

headline.main: Google Phones Target Apple but Could Leave Samsung Vulnerable
headline.print_headline: Google Phones Target Apple but Could Leave Samsung Vulnerable

snippet: Apple Inc, Alphabet Inc's Google and Coca-Cola Co topped the list of the world's 100 most valuable brands in 2016, while technology and automotive brands dominated the overall rankings, according to a new report from brand consultancy Interbrand.

headline.main: Apple, Google, Coca-Cola Top List of 100 Most Valuable Brands: Report
headline.print_headline: Apple, Google, Coca-Cola Top List of 100 Most Valuable Brands: Report

snippet: Samsung Electronics is joining the race to create the smartest digital assistant by acquiring Viv, a Silicon Valley startup launched by the same entrepreneurs who sold Siri to Apple.

headline.main: Samsung Joins Digital Assistant Race With Acquisition of Viv
headline.print_headline: Samsung Joins Digital Assistant Race With Acquisition of Viv

snippet: Dialog Semiconductor, the maker of chips used in Apple and Samsung Electronics' smartphones, said it was reviewing its full-year guidance after a Chinese holiday helped bolster third-quarter sales.

headline.main: Dialog Semi Reviews Guidance as Chinese Holiday Boosts Third Quarter Sales
headline.print_headline: Dialog Semi Reviews Guidance as Chinese Holiday Boosts Third Quarter Sales

snippet: Special Agent Jack Bennett was at the FBI's computer investigation lab in Quantico, Virginia, on a Sunday in March when an outside company showed the bureau how it could hack into an iPhone used by one of the San Bernardino shooters.

headline.main: New FBI Head in San Francisco Was Key Figure in iPhone Hack
headline.print_headline: New FBI Head in San Francisco Was Key Figure in iPhone Hack

snippet: Tech giant Samsung Electronics Co Ltd said on Thursday it is acquiring U.S. artificial intelligence (AI) platform developer Viv Labs Inc, a firm run by a co-creator of Apple Inc's Siri voice assistant program.

headline.main: Samsung Electronics to Acquire Artificial Intelligence Firm Viv, Run by Siri Co-Creator
headline.print_headline: Samsung Electronics to Acquire Artificial Intelligence Firm Viv, Run by Siri Co-Creator

snippet: Open Whisper Systems, which makes the encryption app Signal, received a subpoena for user data earlier this year but wasn’t allowed to talk about it.

headline.main: Daily Report: Another Round in the Privacy vs. Security Debate, This Time With the Signal App

snippet: A system built to scan emails for spam, child pornography and malware allowed Yahoo to search for a terrorist organization’s “signature” to satisfy a secret court order, several sources say.

headline.main: Yahoo Said to Have Aided U.S. Email Surveillance by Adapting Spam Filter
headline.print_headline: Yahoo Said to Have Adapted Email Scanner to Aid U.S. Surveillance

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and NICOLE PERLROTH

snippet: Scarred by the global recall of its flagship smartphone, Samsung Electronics Co is set to report on Friday it still expects a small rise in third-quarter profit, analysts say, with healthy sales of memory chips and displays easing the pain.

headline.main: At Samsung, Strong Q3 Chip Sales to Ease Sting of Note 7 Hangover
headline.print_headline: At Samsung, Strong Q3 Chip Sales to Ease Sting of Note 7 Hangover

snippet: Open Whisper Systems received a subpoena for information on its Signal app subscribers and an order not to talk about it, a practice Microsoft and others say is too prevalent, and unconstitutional.
abstract: Encryption app maker Open Whisper Systems joins Microsoft and other tech firms criticizing Justice Dept for using excessive tactics to get user data; companies find particularly worrisome non-expiring, court-appointed gag orders, which prevents them from notifying customers government is subpoenaing their data; with help from American Civil Liberties Union, Open Whisper Systems was able to get part of its gag order lifted, but is still not allowed to tell certain account holders they are under investigation.

headline.main: Subpoenas and Gag Orders Show Government Overreach, Tech Companies Argue
headline.print_headline: Federal Tactics in Data Pursuit Are Excessive, Tech Firms Say

byline.original: By NICOLE PERLROTH and KATIE BENNER
